content.notes: Content not refactored in Phase 1; original preserved under payload.

payload.posterTitle: Europe: Ancient Forests, Fjords, and Living Shores

biomes.name: Svalbard Arctic Tundra
biomes.description: Svalbard’s tundra is a brief summer world of moss, flowers, and melting ice. Reindeer graze on green patches while glaciers and sea ice shape the coast of this high Arctic island chain.

biomes.name: Macaronesian Laurel Forests
biomes.description: Macaronesian laurel forests cloak Atlantic islands in cool mist. These evergreen woods are ancient in feel, with mossy trees, wet air, and many species that survive in mild ocean climates.

biomes.name: Białowieża Forest
biomes.description: Białowieża Forest is one of Europe’s last great lowland old‑growth forests. Ancient oaks and mixed woods provide habitat for bison, wolves, and woodpeckers in a living time capsule.

biomes.name: Norwegian Fjords
biomes.description: Norway’s fjords are deep sea inlets carved by glaciers. Steep cliffs, waterfalls, and quiet villages line these blue corridors where mountains drop straight into the ocean.

biomes.name: Plitvice Lakes
biomes.description: Plitvice Lakes are a chain of clear pools and waterfalls. Mineral-rich water builds natural dams, creating terraces of turquoise lakes linked by cascades through forest.

biomes.name: Wadden Sea
biomes.description: The Wadden Sea is a vast tidal flat along the North Sea coast. Twice a day, the water pulls back to reveal mud and sand where millions of migrating birds refuel.

biomes.name: Camargue Wetlands
biomes.description: The Camargue is a marshy river delta in southern France. Lagoons, reeds, and salt flats support flamingos, wild horses, and a mix of fresh and salty waters shaped by tides and floods.
